article.headline: Canisius 62, St. Peter's 48
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Darnell Wilson scored 19 points and grabbed eight rebounds to lead Canisius past St. Peter's 62-48 in the opening round of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference tournament Friday night. Chuck Harris added 12 points and nine rebounds for the eighth-seeded Golden Griffins (12-18), who advanced to face top-seeded Marist in the quarterfinals Saturday. Todd Sowell scored 21 points for the No. 9-seeded Peacocks (5-25). Wilson's putback with 5:03 left in the first half put the Golden Griffins up 24-23 and they never relinquished the lead. The lead swelled to double digits in the opening minutes of the second half and the Peacocks were unable to threaten the rest of the way. Canisius shot 46.8 percent from the field, had a 36-29 rebounding edge and held St. Peter's to 35.2 percent shooting.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
